text: Then he brought me back to the entrance of the temple. I noticed that water was flowing from under the threshold of the temple toward the east (for the temple faced east). The water was flowing down from under the right side of the temple, from south of the altar.
He led me out by way of the north gate and brought me around the outside of the outer gate that faces toward the east; I noticed that the water was trickling out from the south side.
When the man went out toward the east with a measuring line in his hand, he measured 1,750 feet, and then he led me through water, which was ankle deep.

Again he <st data-num="04058" class="">measured</st> <st data-num="0505" class="">1,750</st> feet and <st data-num="05674" class="">led</st> me <st data-num="05674" class="">through</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, <st data-num="04325" class="">which</st> was now <st data-num="01290" class="">knee deep</st>. Once more he <st data-num="04058" class="">measured</st> <st data-num="0505" class="">1,750</st> feet and <st data-num="05674" class="">led</st> me <st data-num="05674" class="">through</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, which was <st data-num="04975" class="">waist deep</st>.

Again he <st data-num="04058" class="">measured</st> <st data-num="0505" class="">1,750</st> feet, and it was a <st data-num="05158 0834">river</st> I <st data-num="03201" class="">could</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">cross</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> had <st data-num="01342" class="">risen</st>; <st data-num="04325" class="">it</st> was <st data-num="07813" class="">deep enough to swim in</st>, a <st data-num="05158" class="">river</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> could <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed</st>.

He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?”

Then he led me back to the bank of the river.

When I had <st data-num="07725" class="">returned</st>, I <st data-num="02009" class="">noticed</st><n id="1" /> a <st data-num="03966" class="">vast</st> <st data-num="07227" class="">number</st> of <st data-num="06086" class="">trees</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="08193" class="">banks</st> of the <st data-num="05158" class="">river</st>, on <st data-num="02088" class="">both</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">sides</st>.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, “<st data-num="0428" class="">These</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">go out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">toward</st> the <st data-num="06930" class="">eastern</st> <st data-num="01552" class="">region</st> and <st data-num="03381" class="">flow down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="06160" class="">rift valley</st>; when they <st data-num="0935" class="">enter</st> the Dead <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">where</st> the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st> is stagnant,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> <st data-num="07495" class="">become fresh</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="03605" class="">Every</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">living</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">creature</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="08317" class="">swarms</st> <st data-num="0413 03605 0834 08033">where</st> the <st data-num="05158" class="">river</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0935" class="">flows</st> will <st data-num="02421" class="">live</st>; there will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="07227 03966">many</st> <st data-num="01710" class="">fish</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">flow</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>. It will <st data-num="07495" class="">become fresh</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03605" class="">everything</st> will <st data-num="02425" class="">live</st> <st data-num="0834 08033">where</st> the <st data-num="05158" class="">river</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">flows</st>.

<st data-num="01728" class="">Fishermen</st> will <st data-num="05975" class="">stand</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">beside</st> it; from <st data-num="05872" class="">En Gedi</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="05882" class="">En Eglaim</st> they will <st data-num="04894" class="">spread</st> <st data-num="02764" class="">nets</st>. They will <st data-num="01961" class="">catch</st> <st data-num="07227 03966">many</st> <st data-num="04327" class="">kinds</st> of <st data-num="01710" class="">fish</st>, like the <st data-num="01710" class="">fish</st> of the <st data-num="01419" class="">Great</st> <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>.<n id="1" />

But its <st data-num="01207" class="">swamps</st> and its <st data-num="01360" class="">marshes</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07495" class="">become fresh</st>; they will <st data-num="05414" class="">remain</st> <st data-num="04417" class="">salty</st>.

On both sides of the river’s banks, every kind of tree will grow for food. Their leaves will not wither nor will their fruit fail, but they will bear fruit every month because their water source flows from the sanctuary. Their fruit will be for food and their leaves for healing.”
This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “Here are the borders you will observe as you allot the land to the 12 tribes of Israel. (Joseph will have two portions.)
You must divide it equally just as I vowed to give it to your forefathers; this land will be assigned as your inheritance.
“This will be the border of the land: On the north side, from the Great Sea by way of Hethlon to the entrance of Zedad;

<st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st>, <st data-num="01268" class="">Berothah</st>, <st data-num="05453" class="">Sibraim</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> is <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="01834" class="">Damascus</st> and the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st>, as far as <st data-num="02694" class="">Hazer Hattikon</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> is <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="02362" class="">Hauran</st>.

The <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">run</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st> to <st data-num="02703" class="">Hazar Enan</st>, at the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="01834" class="">Damascus</st>, and on the <st data-num="06828 06828">north</st> is the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st>. This is the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st> <st data-num="06285" class="">side</st>.

On the <st data-num="06921" class="">east</st> <st data-num="06285" class="">side</st>, <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> <st data-num="02362" class="">Hauran</st> and <st data-num="01834" class="">Damascus</st>, and <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st> and the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, will be the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st>. You will <st data-num="04058" class="">measure</st> from the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="06931" class="">eastern</st> <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st>. This is the <st data-num="06921" class="">east</st> <st data-num="06285" class="">side</st>.

On the <st data-num="05045 08486 ">south</st> <st data-num="06285" class="">side</st> it will run from <st data-num="08559" class="">Tamar</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">waters</st> of <st data-num="04808" class="">Meribah</st> <st data-num="06946" class="">Kadesh</st>, the <st data-num="05158" class="">river</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="01419" class="">Great</st> <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>. This is the <st data-num="08486 05045">south</st> <st data-num="06285" class="">side</st>.
On the west side the Great Sea will be the boundary to a point opposite Lebo Hamath. This is the west side.
“This is how you will divide this land for yourselves among the tribes of Israel.

You <st data-num="01961" class="">must</st> <st data-num="05307" class="">allot</st> it as an <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> among yourselves and for the <st data-num="01616" class="">resident foreigners</st> who <st data-num="01481" class="">live</st> <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> you, <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> have <st data-num="03205" class="">fathered</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> you. You must <st data-num="01961" class="">treat</st> them as <st data-num="0249" class="">native-born</st> among the <st data-num="01121" class="">people</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>; they will <st data-num="05307" class="">be allotted</st> an <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> the <st data-num="07626" class="">tribes</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.<n id="1" />
In whatever tribe the resident foreigner lives, there you will give him his inheritance,” declares the Sovereign Lord.
